英文法規名稱: Schemes for Guidance and Education to Persons Committing Sex Transaction with Child and Youth
中文法規名稱: 兒童及少年性交易犯罪行為人輔導教育辦法
沿革內容:
1.Promulgated by order Tai (89) Nei Chung Sher Tze No. 8976358 dated 27th April 2000
2.Amended on March 31, 2006

法規內容.條文內容: The Schemes are established in accordance with paragraph 1, article 35 of Child and Youth Sexual Transaction Prevention Act (“the Act”), paragraph 8, article 2 of Enforcement Rules of Child and Youth Sexual Transaction Prevention Act.
The person who is convicted to the crime specified in articles 22 to 29 of the Act (hereinafter called “the Convict”) should accept guidance and education of the schemes.

The competent authorities of municipality or provincial county (city) governments shall arrange the course with curricular hours not less than twelve (12) hours pursuant to article 4 of the Act when undertaking the guidance and education.

The prosecution and correction organizations shall provide the competent authorities of the municipality or county (city) where the Convict to be educated lives with the dossier of the Convict to be educated including the address, residence or the place where he commits such crime.
The dossier mentioned in preceding paragraph shall include the information regarding the guidance conducted by the correction organization in order to carry on the treatment and guidance to the Convict to be educated.
The correction organization shall provide such dossier two months before the expiration of the term of imprisonment or after approval on the bail application but before release of such person.

The competent authorities of the municipality or county (city) shall establish the case data of the Convict to be educated upon receipt of such dossier.
The case data mentioned in previous paragraph shall be kept in confidentiality.　The use of such data shall be in compliance with specific purpose and the rights of the person concerned shall be respected in good faith, which shall not surpass the extent of guidance and education required.

The competent authorities of the municipality or county (city) shall notify the Convict to be educated in writing of accepting the guidance and education.
The Convict may apply for extension to the competent authorities of the municipality or county (city) or to apply the transfer of such guidance and education to the municipality or county (city) in other locations within ten (10) days upon receipt of such notice or before the implementation of such guidance and education if he is not available to accept the guidance and education as scheduled but with rational grounds.　The application for extension may be submitted twice as maximum. The administration fee for the transfer of guidance and education should be paid by the original municipality or county (city).

In case the Convict to be educated is justified to be psychotic by the psychiatrist, the competent authorities of the municipality or county (city) shall notify local health authorities to arrange the person concerned to have medical treatment.　During the treatment session, the Convict to be educated shall be exempt from receiving guidance and education.

If the Convict to be educated is also the individual to be supervised, the competent authorities of the municipality or county (city) shall request the youth protection officer or the supervisor of the prosecution agency executing such protection and supervision to urge and intensify the guidance and education of the Convict to be educated.

The competent authorities of the municipality or county (city) shall sanction the Convict to be educated in accordance with paragraph 2 of article 35 of the Act if he refuses to accept such guidance and education, or receives guidance and education with time less than required.　In case of the Convict to be educated as person to be supervised, the supervision organization executing protection shall be informed of the facts mentioned above.

The competent authorities of the municipality or county (city) shall undertake at its discretion or commission to other organizations concerned, professional institutions or entities incorporated under the ROC laws to conduct the guidance and education of the Convict to be educated.
These Schemes are effective from the date of issue.
